metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25723 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A reachable assertion issue was found in the USB EHCI emulation code of QEMU. It could occur while processing USB requests due to missing handling of DMA memory map failure. A malicious privileged user within the guest may abuse this flaw to send bogus USB requests and crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-25723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-block-extra - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-guest-agent - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-arm - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-common - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-data - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-gui - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-mips - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-misc - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-ppc - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-s390x - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-sparc - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86 - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-user - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-user-static - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
qemu-utils - 1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.2+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
